summary: This bill, the Michael Enzi Voluntary Protection Program Act, authorizes the Department of Labor to establish and administer a voluntary program recognizing employers with comprehensive safety and health management systems. It details program requirements including applications, self and on-site evaluations, information sharing, and re-evaluations. The bill mandates technology modernization, establishes a tiered safety challenge program, and provides funding for implementation. It ensures a smooth transition from existing programs and exempts participating worksites from programmed inspections while prohibiting fees for participation.
